sentences.en: A proposal offered nullify or substitute for a previous one.
sentences.cn: 一项用来替代先前提案的提议.

sentences.en: Do you think you will get to the Finals ( and nullify all of this conversation )?
sentences.cn: 如果你们打进总决赛,你是否觉得所有的争议都可以被 消除 了?

sentences.en: He has no right to nullify laws.
He may be able to nullify that disadvantage by offering a wider variety of produce.
sentences.cn: 他也许能通过供应更为多样化的农产品来抵消那一劣势。

sentences.en: How can we nullify the enemy's propaganda?
sentences.cn: 怎样才能抵销敌人的宣传?

sentences.en: If voted into law, it will nullify the CRB's decision.
sentences.cn: 如果这项提案被投票选入法律, 它将使crb的决定无效.

sentences.en: Recent inflation could nullify the economic growth of the last several years.
sentences.cn: 最近的通货膨胀可能会抵消过去数年的经济增长。

sentences.en: Removal of this anode for any purpose will NULLIFY THE WARRANTY.
sentences.cn: 无论因何原因拆卸这种阳极棒,都使得本热水器的质量保证无效.

sentences.en: The election results were nullified because of voter fraud.
sentences.cn: 由于选票造假，选举结果被宣布无效。

sentences.en: These surface charges partially nullify the effect of the charges on the metal plates.
sentences.cn: 这些表面电荷部分地抵消金属极板上电荷的作用.

sentences.en: This, of course, would nullify the effect of the move and merely accelerate inflation.
sentences.cn: 这毫无疑问会使该举措完全失效，而仅仅只是加速通货膨胀。

sentences.en: What if some did not have faith? Will their lack of faith nullify God's faithfulness?
sentences.cn: 既便有不信的,这有何妨 呢 .难道他们的不信,就废掉神的信 么 .

words.tran_cn: 无效的，无价值的；等于零的
无效；废弃；取消；（美）州对联邦法令的拒绝执行或承认
废弃者；使无效者；取消者
无效；无价值的事物或人；[数] 零度；退化阶数

trans.tran_en: to make something lose its effect or value
to officially state that something has no legal force
